content.description: At the start, crimpy moves in the thin crack, side Layback, Pockety. The mantle move into the lower shelf, was difficult using left elbow/arm, search for Good right hand, not much available. Up to honeycomb section with lots of little finger grabs and balanced moves gains. Up to roof, traversing to the anchor. My first ascent, ode to daughter, first and only.
content.location: Giant Z formation. To the left of O wall. Facing same direction as Christ Died. Thin crack to right above what now looks like “Blue Grunks” spray paint.

climbs.name: Z's Go with the Flo Traverse

content.description: Start on the Boulder to your left,  enter the lower rail, flail if you like,  on to a squat juggy ledge,  and matching traverse,  around some sloping engagements,  working your wavy way through, on to being tougher than I thought,  with a nice ...
content.location: At the bottom of Z's wall,  around the corner from  and south west from the  O wall, He had a lot to say,  Christ Died.

climbs.name: Pleasure-full
climbs.fa: Unknown (assume its been climbed before; not on MP; Jim Arnold did it 7/3/2020)

content.description: Fun, pleasurable little climb. No discernible crux. Stay 2-3 feet from the right arête. Stemming/back-stepping the chimney portion makes the first half significantly easier (but still fun). A full face climb might push the grade up a bit. Good hands above the chimney.
content.protection: TR; anchor to the solid tree above; pass your master point through the brush at the edge of the cliff to a small but identifiable indent 2-3 feet in from the point; mossy on top, use rope protector.
content.location: Just inside the obvious gap/chimney about 40 meters south of the Padua crack. Start is at the base of the chimney, 2-3 feet in (just at the end of the roof to the south and with the roof to the north right behind you).

content.description: Coming up into the honey comb section, is a search to find your schmearin and holds
content.location: Red rocks start, cruise up to the anchor, right side of tree, slight reverse waterfall, starting about 2 feet out.

content.description: See New Wave Mang. Hang way left past the edge of Z and circle around the upper Wave to anchor. Winner
content.location: New Wave Mang start, wide left hook variation

climbs.name: Jughead
climbs.fa: Unknown (assume it's been climbed before; not on MP; Chris Reynolds did it 7/3/2020; if anyone has info on earlier ascents/names, please update!)

content.description: Crux is the start/the second ledge, regardless of which start you choose (see below). Two (three?) possible starts (see photo). Direct would likely bump this to 5.10/5.10+ (thoughts?). Bouldering (V?) the cave/roof would push this way up and would add a significant chance of decking. Direct would likely require a heel hook onto the second ledge with marginal hands above. Traverse start is a touch spicy but fun. Once below the master point, it's a slightly slabby, juggy climb to 5-6' below the top. Top out is mostly slopers intermixed at a lot of moss/lichen but easily doable. Watch out for the thorny plants at the top out.
content.protection: TR; anchor to the solid tree at the top
content.location: Between Slippery When Wet and Padua wall crack. Start ~8' to the south of the chimney, next to the log (see photo; unless attempting to boulder the cave/roof). Direct would be straight up from the north edge of the first ledge. Traverse starts 5-6' to the south onto the second ledge. Spoiler alert/beta tip on the traverse: scrunch down to get around the initial overhanging bit when moving left/north.

content.description: Sit start matched on the undercling. Boulder up and as far left as possible without dragging on the detached boulder beneath. Heel hooking through the crux will gain you slopers and the first ledge. Step up onto the face and traverse left of the arete. Pump your way to the top.
content.protection: Traditional anchor built on the tree for Blue Grunks
content.location: Locate the large overhang to the left of Blue Grunks.

content.description: Nice n’ easy walk up the big blocks, gaining a couple easy finger jugs for lift to some balanced footwork. NBD
content.location: Following the easy access of the exposed corners bottom rocks, up to the bottom corner of the Z, staying about 12 inches to the left of anchor

content.description: Nice shady overhung trees, on walking path. Trees overhead for protection. Well aware these walls have been climbed for years, there’s no info here. These are my “First Ascents” and will even need details edited and corrected. I’m green this being my second season, however headed straight for Trad/Crack. I am gathering from the outside what the rating may be. I climb up to 5’11 with take however, I honestly am not yet sure.  Always looking for others input, beta and stories!!! We love meeting the Ol’ timers and hearing what’s been. Peace in climbing y’all! Thanks!
